attributes.action: send an allied task force to eliminate ISIS
attributes.background: ISIS must be destroyed before they can kill more innocent civilians.

attributes.action: Stop media from publicising the nationality of criminals to prevent prejudice
attributes.background: If a nationality is associated with a horrible act of violence in the media, it is easy for readers to then associate people of that nationality with acts of terror and violence. This can make innocent people of that nationality very prone to racism and prejudice.

attributes.action: Switch the UK timezone to match the rest of Europe
attributes.background: The rest of western Europe has changed their timezone to UTC + 1 and since these countries are extremely close, it would be sense from a trade, enterprise and consumer point of view that this should be changed for the better.

attributes.action: Let motorcycle riders over 25, drive cars up to 1.0 without L plates and test
attributes.background: I can drive safely and confidently, and so can all other motorcyclists that are old enough to do this maturely. Ie over 25 year olds. In a low powered car it is going to be far safer in poor weather, rain. Wind,  winter conditions etc than on a motorcycle without the hassle and cost of another test

attributes.action: Make  verbal abuse of teachers by students and parents an offense like the NHS
attributes.background: Teachers need respect given to them to ensure that they can perform well in the classroom. Often behaviour policies in schools are so varied that students, parents and carers in some cases seem to get away without any consequences to verbal abuse of the teacher.
attributes.additional_details: This is a stop verbal abuse of teachers campaign.

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Place an additional tax of 10p a packet on chewing gum to pay the clean up costs
attributes.background: According to the LGA it costs £1.50 to clean a piece of chewing gum from a pavement. Not all chewing gum users are irresponsible about its disposal but it is wrong for general taxation to pay the clean up costs. A levy of 10p a packet (plus an explanation on the packet) will offset part of the costs
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimate that it costs £60M a year to clean up chewing gum. http://www.local.gov.uk/media-releases/-/journal_content/56/10180/6745145/NEWS

attributes.action: Change School Holiday Rules
attributes.background:
I have 2 children and have worked in a school for 6 years.
Booking a holiday in the school break can be double the amount than in term time,as the travel firms give school holiday weeks high season rates, making it impossible for lots of families to go away on holiday.
Lets change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The 6 week holiday is to long for many reasons.
I suggest taking 2 weeks off the 6 week break.Let children have these 2 weeks a year in term time,this way there will be no set period each year for holiday companies to include them in high season rates, as there would be if added to half term breaks.The teachers could take their 2 weeks the last week of the Summer and Autumn terms, as these are wind down weeks and not much work takes place,it could easily be covered by TA's or relief teachers.

attributes.action: Release official files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher
attributes.background:
Downing Street files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher are being kept secret despite rules stating official documents should be published after 20 years. 
There is no legitimate reason to keep them out the public domain and they should be released immediately.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Ban public transport peak fares, especially on suburban commuter routes.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the few countries in the world where commuter public transport users suffer a peak fare system, with transport often owned by foreign interests. Commuters are essentially being penalised and profited from unnecessarily as they go to work, often making car usage more attractive.
attributes.additional_details:
Budapest - 80p per individual suburban bus or underground journey any time of day 
Kuala Lumpar -  23p per stop on underground Metro (modern air-conditioned Siemens trains) any time of day
Barcelona - £1.80 individual bus or underground journey any time of day
Lisbon - individual journey bus on-board fare - £1.50 any time of day
Melbourne - all-zone 2-hour tram or bus ticket, £2 any time of day
Bangkok - daily any time Skytrain pass £2.60 (Bangkok is a very big city of 12 million people!)

attributes.action: We demand Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty be invoked within three months hereof.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, we, the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland delivered a mandate, pursuant to the EU Referendum Act 2015, that we exit the EU. We hereby demand that effect be given to said mandate by way of invoking Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty within 3 months.
attributes.additional_details:
"I do declare that no foreign prince, person, prelate, state or potentate hath or ought to have jurisdiction, power, superiority, pre-eminence or authority within this Realm." - Bill of Rights, 1689

These words serve to enshrine British sovereignty in its Constitution which remains violated for as long as the UK is a member of the EU. Notwithstanding a mandate to remedy the position by exiting the EU,  PM Ms. May suggests exit will be delayed or worse, not happen at all. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Stop the banks from creating money from commecial debt, ending boom and bust.
attributes.background: The creation of commecial money from the inflationary act of creating money from debt is responsible for the boom and bust cycles. We need to end the fractional reserve banking where banks are allowed to lend money that they do not have, gaining purchasing power and interest from money they created.
attributes.additional_details:
http://positivemoney.org/videos/97-owned-monetary-reform-documentary/

http://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/fractionalreservebanking.asp

http://positivemoney.org/2011/09/fractional-reserve-banking-leads-booms-busts/

attributes.action: Allow encrypted information to be accessed by security services and government
attributes.background: Terrorists and criminals frequently use the Internet and social media to encourage acts of terrorism and criminal activity. If there is a cause for concern, the government and security services should be allowed access to prevent attacks and protect citizens.

attributes.action: Stop the rise of youth crime- introduce harsher punishments as a deterrent.
attributes.background: As young people we think youth crime is a problem and more needs to be done about it. We think there should be harsher punishments, especially for repeated offenders as it is unfair all young people and teenagers are labeled 'thugs'.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Daily Mail, under 18s commit a quarter of all crimes.

Statistics on www.gov.uk show that in 2013/14 there were 90,769 offences which resulted in a disposal, and the most common offence was violence against the person.

attributes.action: Amend Fixed-Term Parliaments Act to require a General Election if the PM resigns
attributes.background: When voting during a General Election, it is likely voters base their decision not only on who they want to represent them locally, but also who they would like to represent the country on the global stage. If the PM resigns, the public should get to vote again based on the new leadership.
attributes.additional_details:
Why the resignation comes about is irrelevant - this is NOT to do with the current Brexit issue.

This is NOT a request for a GE based purely on the outcome of the referendum (and so is vastly different to petition 133548), but for a change in the law to cover scenarios whereby the PM chooses to resign during a fixed term parliament. 

The public should get to choose the new Prime Minister, knowing who it is that's going to lead the country for the next 5 years, not just the members of a party.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to specify menu items that are microwave meals
attributes.background:
I propose that restaurants should be required to inform customers on their menu whether a meal is microwaved or prepared fresh.

A large number of restaurants and pubs regularly include ready meals and microwave meals on their menu but are not required to inform customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Requiring restaurants to state this information would allow customers to make a more informed decision on what they're eating, as many people like myself would rather not include microwave meals in their diet, especially when paying a premium for eating it in a restaurant.

This change would hopefully lead customers to ordering freshly made meals, encouraging restaurants to change their practices and perhaps helping their unskilled staff gain kitchen qualifications to help further their careers.

attributes.action: Prime Minister suspend 3rd Heathrow runway until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for 3rd runway Heathrow can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case Edinburgh & Glasgow become future gateways to Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of Heathrow expansion economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for 3rd Heathrow runway is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Less need for Heathrow expansion

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Make relevant work experience mandatory for students doing University courses.
attributes.background: I have found many Graduates I know who are unable to secure themselves job roles due to lack of experience. Also according to The Guardian in 2013, almost half of the Graduates are jobless. They are rejected due to the fact that they do not have 1 year experience. Exception is for those who have it.
attributes.additional_details:
A source for my claim is shown below: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/nov/19/half-recent-uk-graduates-stuck-jobs-ons

By making gaining work experience proposal mandatory, economy may boost. Less JSA claimants. Less students debts. The list goes on. It usually takes years and I mean years for Graduates to secure their relevant job roles due to lack of experience. Yes, you may say that they can do work experience while searching but that's not always the case due to lack of finance.

attributes.action: Final Leader elections in Government or Opposition should be by national vote.
attributes.background: Parlimentary leadership elections are decided by a small fraction of the electorate. This could see a vastly different Prime Minister or leader of the Opposition than the electorate intended to put in power and could in instances give rise to instability at a time when greater stability is required.

attributes.action: Sue the EU via the ECJ for the monies the UK should of had under our old rebate
attributes.background: In 2005, Blair gave up 40% of the UK rebate in return for future reforms of the EU. Since those reforms were never made - we should be refunded the money. Full transcripts of those meetings should be made public to ensure the EU did not persuade blair by offering him help with an EU presidency bid
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/6516753/Tony-Blairs-decision-to-cut-the-EU-rebate-cost-9.3billion-report-shows.html

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://forbritain.org/140518_eu_rebate_blair.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwjph9Wk7OfNAhVkJcAKHaF9Cd8QFggjMAI&usg=AFQjCNFmtmQSYDDg_kKTb48fcQY19PZ5ow&sig2=WGvOnpdL7aT0BjfKUkL4zw

attributes.action: Procure the Government to adopt Geraint Davies's private member's Bill.
attributes.background:
Many false and misleading claims were made during the campaign which deceived people who were not able to judge the issues dispassionately. 
These gross misrepresentations at the very least justify a second referendum to determine whether the result is truly the settled will of the people.
attributes.additional_details:
37% of the eligible electorate voted to leave, which means that 63% did not.
Many quite simply were duped into believing extravagant promises which were unachievable, and on which the polititians concerned backtracked afterwards.
Referenda are not binding. 
The sheer magnitude of the consequences already being felt is too great to allow the fundamentally flawed result to be implemented without at the very least clarification of the settled will of the people, or a free vote in both Houses.

attributes.action: Change the way political parties are funded.
attributes.background: Political Parties should be funded from tax revenues only. There should be heavy financial penalties for Parties which renege on manifesto commitments; “fail to mention” major policies in their manifesto which they then implement.
attributes.additional_details: Such funding would help achieve a 'level playing field' for all parties and the removal of rich backers with vested interests and agendas. Financial penalties would help clean up campaigning prior to elections and restore a degree of trust in politicians and the system.

attributes.action: Giving food brought to concerts to homeless so that none goes to waste.
attributes.background: Having recently changed my eating habits and diet that I was going to take some oats and dried fruit at a concert to enjoy as I hoped to sneak them through, in retrospect this was silly but I was still appalled that they simply threw it away despite everything I had being perfectly edible!

attributes.action: Make it so you do not have to declare none fault accidents on motor insurance
attributes.background: Why are people been penalised for something they didn't cause or do motor insurance goes up for thous who had a accident that wasn't their fault and it shouldn't no longer be aloud to happen we should have to tell the insurance company for accident that are none fault

attributes.action: no income tax on overtime for people who earn £9 per hour or less
attributes.background: many people on low wages find them self having to work over time to make ends meet, so I'm asking that people on a low wage (£9 per hour or less) should not be taxed on over time that they need just to get by each month

attributes.action: We should have a cross party coalition to negotiate our exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
Our exit from the EU should be negotiated with at least two members from the Brexit camp.
This isn't just a petition aimed at people who voted Leave, these negotiations affect all of us, so please sign this petition and let's get the right people in the negotiations to get the right deal for us!

attributes.action: Lower the age of sexual consent to 14 if both parties are under 16
attributes.background: I would like action on this petition because I feel that sexual consent laws are outdated. I feel as if sexual consent should be legal (if both under 16 and over 14)  like a "Romeo and Juliet" Law like they have in other countries. I think this would help teenagers feel better about sexual consent.

attributes.action: Fund our NHS with an additional £3billion per annum using former EU finances
attributes.background: Our national health service is wavering under the weight of increased expectations and lack of funding. This petition would like to see that NHS staff are paid and treated fairly, compensated properly for any work related illness and supported through any work related illness as may be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: In addition to this there are an increased number of reports of missing medical records that are needed to claim work related illness compensation. The funds should be drawn from the savings of leaving the EU as suggested by the leave campaign. Such insinuations have been recognised in hindsight as a significant influence on the voting of the British public and many feel that the retraction of that notion is unjust.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on lowering income tax to 5% for earnings below £80k per annum
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we have come to understand that the will of the people is absolute. Even when it is contradictory to expert advice, based on a foundation of lies and damaging for services vital to both the people and the economy.

We now call for similar action regarding income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
A reduction in income tax will give back control of finances to the British public to spend on whatever they deem is appropriate for the good of the country. This is reflective of the position on our EU membership.

This would ensure that local communities are supported through a boost to spending and that the public as a whole will be happier.

We believe that this petition is in the interests of the majority of the population and that a referendum would be appropriate.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Conduct an Independence referendum for Scotland,Wales and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the people living in the UK under HM's government rule after voting on EU regarding referendum demand an Independence referendum for the states of Wales,Scotland and Northern Ireland.People should have the right of such a referendum because after Brexit vote opinions of people are changed.

attributes.action: Religious holidays should not affect your attendance at educational institutes
attributes.background: Those in educational establishments should be afforded a day off for a major religious festival (eg; Eid, Diwali) without this going against their attendance percentage. 100% attendance should still be achievable in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: A General election before October and summer recess in parliament cancelled?
attributes.background:
1. For there to be a change in the law with immediate effect to enable a general election.
2. For parliamentary summer recess to be cancelled to enable resolution of Brexit.
3. A change in the law to separate financial services from electoral register to enable all and the young to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The 1st two articles in this are very much self explanatory, however article 3' is specifically designed to ensure those who due to debt collectors having access to the electoral registration system, so can track those poor people down who were victims of the GEC, can finally clear house in parliament and punish those responsible and not the immigrants blamed for the countries mess.  Also article 3' will see the law change to make it easy for the UK's young to vote by allowing temp registration.

attributes.action: To stop the right to roam and bring in a trespassing law into Scotland
attributes.background: Privately owned property should have the right to refuse anyone the right to walk on their land

attributes.action: N.u.t striking should be illegal....
attributes.background: they have 91.7% wanting to strike with only a 24.7% overall turnout so the minority of disruptive teachers cause chaos across the country
attributes.additional_details: N.u.t claim that this is partly due to school funding which I find staggering as every child at our primary school has use of an iPad for example. regarding hours worked is also ridiculous it is well known that teachers get more annual leave than any other proffesion so to quote a 60 hour week is proposer oust if they calculated there hours worked over a year it would be significantly less than the average worker doing between 40 and 60 hours a week with only 20 days leave

attributes.action: To remove the copyright laws in communal rooms in sheltered housing .
attributes.background: if you live in a sheltered housing building , and want to watch a video / dvd in the communal room with other residents you have to pay a copyright fee of over £400 a year these people are all over 75 all have tv licences for there flats so why should they have to pay to watch in the communal room .
attributes.additional_details: Stop robbing the retired ,  old aged person and start giving a little back .

attributes.action: Government to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018 on joining the European Union
attributes.background: People who previously advocated leaving the EU had their voice heard in a call for a referendum. In fairness, -but also in terms of observing democratic principles-, the people who (now) advocate to join the EU should also have their voice heard in their call for a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, ask this Government (or its successive Government) to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018, on joining the European Union, asking the people of the United Kingdom to choose between the following two options: ‘Join the EU’ or ‘Remain out of the EU’.

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.

attributes.action: Make it an act of treason to attempt to overturn legitimate elections/referendum
attributes.background: To attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action subverts the nation's democratic nature.
attributes.additional_details: It is an act of treason to aid the enemy: to attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action runs counter to the nation's democratic nature.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit for vans below 7.5ton to the same as cars on a A road
attributes.background:
I've been a van driver for as long as I can remember.
And it just seems mad that a van has to do 50mph on a A road .
When vans this day and age are more safer  than most car's.
Cause more accidents as cars can do 60mph and get impatient and do dangerous overtaking.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using both lanes on the 2 lane carriageway A1m,To stop congestion
attributes.background: There is chronic delays on the 2 carriageway A1m by HGV's overtaking HGV's forcing all traffic to 40-50 mph which leads to stood traffic at five lane ends & ferrybridge

attributes.action: Allow students aged 16+ whose parents receive financial aid to gain employment.
attributes.background: Students who's parents receive financial aid from the governments benefits system should be allowed to gain employment as they currently are not. If a parent or career receives benefits then the house hold income must stay the same to what is provided by the government.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing students to gain employment it allows them to learn financial sustainability and also gives them vital work experience which is widely needed to gain future employment. I am a 17 year old student who has to volunteer to use up spare time as I cant gain employment. I would like to earn my own money but cant due to legal reasons. Even if I could only earn a certain amount would be better than none. So please help me with this petition and sign and share to gain work rights for students

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.action: Government should give 350 UK charities 1 million each,
attributes.background: I believe in Our Country, I believe in Values and Standards. Likewise I believe in Charity.  Instead of sending 350 million per week to The EU give 350 UK Charities 1 million each.
attributes.additional_details: Have worked in Charity Shops Regularly also Donate When Able To.
